title: Wayne Rooney treats his eldest three sons to a luxury yacht ride in Barbados
text:
Wayne Rooney and his three eldest sons continued their luxuriant holiday in Barbados on Wednesday, while his wife Coleen continued to recover in the UK after falling unwell.

The father-of-four, 33, oversaw the three boys as they enjoyed a trip on a stunning yacht.

He watched as Kai, nine, Klay, six, and Kit, three, frolicked on the deck, the eldest of the trio launching himself into the blue waters.

Lap of luxury: Wayne Rooney and his three eldest sons continued their luxuriant holiday in Barbados on Wednesday, while his wife Coleen continued to recover in the UK after falling unwell

The Rooneys' second-eldest son followed his brother, hurling himself into the brine.

Wayne stayed covered up on the boat in a grey Tee.

He chatted to his in-laws, Coleen's parents Colette and Tony, and the crew aboard the boat.

Youngest brother Cass has remained with Coleen in the UK, while she sits the family outing out thanks to an 'infection'.

The day before, Wayne was looking a little despondent as he holidayed without his wife.

The family are all staying at their favourite location, Sandy Lane and Wayne was sure to cover up again on a boat ride the day before, wearing a red top, shorts and a baseball cap.

Fun in the sun: Wayne watched as Kai, nine, Klay, six, and Kit, three, frolicked on the deck

Daredevil: The eldest of the trio launching himself into the blue waters

Undercover: Wayne stayed covered up on the boat in a grey Tee as he chatted to his in-laws, Coleen's parents Colette and Tony

The sporting star looked stoney-faced as he joined his children and in-laws for the fun boat ride, and helped them on and off the boat going towards the beach.

As he enjoyed a break from football before beginning his role as Assistant Coach for Derby County in 2020, Wayne sported an unusual scruff as he relaxed with his family on the getaway.

While her family soaked up the sun in the Caribbean, Coleen and her youngest son Cass, 20 months, enjoyed a 'lovely morning in the fresh air' in a local park.

Uploading a shot of her youngest child, Coleen explained she has had to remain in the UK and skip her family's half-term break to Barbados due to illness.

'Lovely morning in the fresh air with Cass,' she posted on Sunday evening. 'We had planned to be with the rest of our family in Barbados for half term break.

Doting dad: The father-of-four, 33, oversaw the three boys as they enjoyed a trip on a stunning yacht

Dare-devils: The Rooneys' middle son followed suit

'Unfortunately I became poorly with an infection before we were due to leave. I am not able to join them for the time being, even though I am feeling better [sic]'

On Sunday, Wayne was spotted touching down in Barbados to join his three other children for their trip, before meeting up with friends and family on the beach near their home on the Caribbean island.

The football star arrived a few days after his sons who jetted over with their grandparents Colette and Anthony McLoughlin, Coleen's parents.

The getaway comes amid Coleen's so-called 'WAG war' with Rebekah, after she accused the wife of Leicester City player Jamie of leaking fake stories about her to The Sun newspaper, something she sternly denied in a post minutes later.

She said 'I don't need the money’ and pointed out other people have had access to her Instagram account.

Chit chat: The adults talked onboard the luxury vessel

The day before: Wayne was looking a little despondent as he holidayed without his wife

Rebekah recently gave an interview with The Daily Mail, in which she insisted arguing with Coleen is akin to rowing 'with a pigeon.'

The I'm A Celebrity star was then pictured returning to the UK in floods of tears after the scandal broke while she herself was on holiday with her football star football Jamie.

She was supported by Jamie as she returned to London's Heathrow Airport from a family trip to Dubai on Saturday.

Earlier this month, The Sun reported that Jamie is so upset with the way things have played out between his wife and Coleen that he has 'unfollowed Wayne on Instagram' - however, Jamie has strenuously denied the claims.

A source had alleged to the publication: 'Jamie has always got on well with Wayne, but he won’t stand for having his wife hung out to dry in public like this.'

Lavish: The family are all staying at their favourite location, Sandy Lane

Overboad: Wayne looked stoney-faced as he joined his children and in-laws for the fun boat ride, and helped them on and off the boat going towards the beach

Busy: Wayne is on the break before beginning his role as Assistant Coach for Derby County in 2020, Wayne sported an unusual scruff as he relaxed with his family on the getaway

Relaxed: Wayne showed off his tattooed arm and toned frame as he relaxed in the sun

Off we go: Wayne was every inch the doting dad as he carried son Kit along

Family: The group took in the scenic views from aboard their boat

Chilled: Wayne soaked up the sun as he cradled his middle child on the beach

The source added that Jamie is standing by Rebekah '100 per cent' as she launches a fight to prove her innocence.

Said a friend: 'He’s totally behind Becky and furious with the Rooneys for the way they have gone about this. He and Wayne always got on well and he likes him. But he has made his feelings clear. Cutting him off on social media is a totally deliberate snub.'

Rebekah cut her family holiday to Dubai short after Coleen's dramatic accusation, which has enthralled Britain in the so-called 'war of the WAGs.'

Sources close to Becky say leading law firm Kingsley Napley has sent Coleen a letter on her behalf demanding she provides them with the evidence she has against Becky so that she can complete her investigation.

Meanwhile, friends of Coleen say she will not be goaded into coming forward with any further evidence as she is happy with her own investigations.

Sunkissed: The star looked relaxed as he spent time with Coleen's parents Colette and Tony

Cute: Colette looked stylish in a white cover up as she held hands with little Kit

Family break: The group looked to be making the most of their sunshine break

Boat trip: The group took in their scenic surroundings aboard the boat

Chillaxed: The family were enjoying some leisure time as Coleen continues to recover at home

Drama: The break comes as Coleen (pictured left in June 2016) has been embroiled in a so-called WAG war with Rebekah (pictured right in February 2019)

Becky has called in a forensic team to analyse her Instagram account.

The aim is to identify the mole who sold fake stories to The Sun from Coleen’s Instagram account.

As part of that probe, they say, they have asked Wayne’s wife to give them the proof they have that the source must have been Becky’s Instagram account.

It's been claimed Rebekah has threatened Coleen with legal action over allegations of leaking staged Instagram stories, warning her: 'Believe me or I'll see you in court.'

The feuding pair are said to be communicating through their lawyers in the wake of the bitter row which has dominated social media and newspapers this week.

Chat: The group whiled away the afternoon on the beach as they chatted

Fun in the sun: Wayne and Kit shared a special moment as they paddled in the sea

Cute: Collette and Kit strolled down the beach together in the sunshine

Scenic: Wayne and Colette caught up as the youngsters played on the beach
description: Wayne Rooney and his three eldest sons continued their luxuriant holiday in Barbados on Wednesday, while his wife Coleen continued to recover in the UK after falling unwell.
